intro: Capurodendron sakalavum, commonly known as the Malagasy starwood, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its bark contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
